title: Cryptosporidium parasite detected in Minnesota groundwater

title_detail.value: Cryptosporidium parasite detected in Minnesota groundwater

summary: When consumed in contaminated water, the microscopic parasite Cryptosporidium can cause symptoms of stomach cramps, diarrhea and fever. Now, researchers have detected evidence of the parasite in about 40 percent of surveyed wells in public water systems in Minnesota -- even wells not influenced by surface water. The team emphasizes that they don't know whether the parasite levels are high enough to actually cause health concerns.
